title: 325btc
author: 325btc
content: The father of btc leave btc So bye bye btc see you at lowest price Can btc disapeare now ? If micheal satoshi saylor leaves ntc company ?Time for exit ?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Bitcoin does not depend on anyone. If Michael Saylor sell all MicroStrategy's bitcoin that they are having, it will only create bear market, but know that bull market will start again and nothing will stop all-time-high.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: 325btc on August 02, 2022, 08:50:31 PMThe father of btc leave btc So bye bye btc see you at lowest price Can btc disapeare now ? If micheal satoshi saylor leaves ntc company ?Time for exit ?Please leave if you want but bitcoin doesn't depend on a single person no matter how powerful or influencing he is! This is not how bitcoin works! That's the beauty of a free global market where no one controls the asset. Bitcoin is available now at a super discounted price and bitcoin believers are accumulating more because we may not see this price point ever again in the future. Those who understand how the bitcoin market works, they are not worried about a person leaving bitcoin. Once this bear cycle is over, it will be a grand slam run awaiting for us!

comments.author: Jason Brendon
comments.body: I don't give a single fu** about someone who sells or buys, whether he is a tycoon or a prisoner.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Do you even read articles?He moved from CEO of MicroStrategy to executive chairman to apparently "focus on the company’s Bitcoin strategy".And what the hell are you talking about? BTC company? "Father of BTC leaving BTC?" And there aren't even news of them selling bitcoin(at least yet). Good lord lmao no offense but your posts get worse and worse by the daily.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: Quote from: 325btc on August 02, 2022, 08:50:31 PMThe father of btc leave btc So bye bye btc see you at lowest price Can btc disapeare now ? If micheal satoshi saylor leaves ntc company ?Time for exit ?They did not created Bitcoin because of Michael Saylor, so how is Michael Saylors ntc company departure or if he sells all his Bitcoin holding gonna affect Bitcoin?, A seller needs a buyer to sell, so selling all his Bitcoin is literally giving it out to another holder , however the only thing I'm very sure of is that,  there's gonna be a little price drop impact to the market due to the sells and the news that will go around, but in the end the market is gonna absorb all the selling pressure just like the China and Elome Musk dump of Bitcoin.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: I'm a bit of a Michael Saylor fan but he is certainly not the Father of BTC, he is just a Whaleand very much a Bitcoiner. He has highlighted many things about Bitcoin which hasgot a lot of people thinking differently about Bitcoin other than its use as an alternativecurrency, transfer of wealth or payment system.If at some stage when he decides he needs to sell his or part of his hodling it will be sensational,but not the death knell of Bitcoin. There were many many people involved in Bitcoin way beforeanyone even knew of Michael Saylor or Microstrategy.

comments.author: Cryptodebjoe
comments.body: The father of btc leave btc So bye bye btc see you at lowest price Can btc disapeare now ? If micheal satoshi saylor leaves ntc company ?Time for exit ?[/quote]According to coindesk desk hub updated on june 29- 2022 written by Stephen Alpher.Michael Saylor MicroStrategy (MSTR) on Wednesday morning said it purchased 480 bitcoins for about $10 million – an average price of $20,817 per coin – during the period from May 3 to June 28.The new additions bring company holdings to 129,699 bitcoins (BTC) acquired for $3.98 billion, or an average cost of $30,664 each. At press time, bitcoin is changing hands at $20,100, making MSTR's stash worth approximately $2.6 billion. So how can someone be buying more 480 bic be said that he is leaving he is more into stratigizing please

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptodebjoe on August 03, 2022, 01:27:59 PMSo how can someone be buying more 480 bic be said that he is leaving he is more into stratigizing pleaseMichael Saylor is still a part of the MicroStrategy company. He simply just moved from the CEO position to an executive chairman position. I assume Saylor simply wants a CEO that would replace him to handle all of the non-bitcoin related business arms of MicroStrategy.Fun fact: MicroStrategy provides business analytics services, financial services, healthcare, etc.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: He didn't leave MicroStrategy, and what made you say that because of Saylor, bitcoin will be doomed? He's just a part of a company that controls a sizable amount of bitcoins. Even if MicroStrategy decides to eventually leave bitcoin behind and focus on other investments, bitcoin can most probably take the blow and come back stronger. There's no use spreading doom and gloom propaganda. We heard it all, and every single time, we just shrug our shoulders and carry on.

comments.author: tadamichi
comments.body: Quote from: 325btc on August 02, 2022, 08:50:31 PMThe father of btc leave btc Another not thought out shitpost. How can the "father of btc" been a naysayer once?Quote from: https://twitter.com/saylor/status/413478389329428480#Bitcoin days are numbered.   It seems like just a matter of time before it suffers the same fate as online gambling.And he started first buying Bitcoin with Microstrategy in like mid 2020. Hes more like a relative newcomer.He also didnt sell any Bitcoin or left Microstrategy. He simply switched roles to focus more on Bitcoin. The complete opposite of what you tried to imply. And that you even considered exiting Bitcoin in case of if saylor did it/ that Bitcoin would fail without him, shows that you still have a lot of learning to do and still dont understand why its important to develop knowledge yourself, instead of trying to sheep onto whoever seems smart.
